title:
On a nonlinear Diophantine equation with powers of three consecutive
  $k$--Lucas Numbers
abstract:
Let $(L_n^{(k)})_{n\geq 2-k}$ be the sequence of $k$--generalized Lucas
numbers for some fixed integer $k\ge 2$ whose first $k$ terms are
$0,\ldots,0,2,1$ and each term afterwards is the sum of the preceding $k$
terms. In this paper, we completely solve the nonlinear Diophantine equation
$\left(L_{n+1}^{(k)}\right)^x+\left(L_{n}^{(k)}\right)^x-\left(L_{n-1}^{(k)}\right)^x=L_m^{(k)}$,
in nonnegative integers $n$, $m$, $k$, $x$, with $k\ge 2$.
